meanings.definition: Lack of physical or emotional feeling or sensitivity.
meanings.sent1: Her insensibility to pain allowed her to endure the injury without flinching.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient's insensibility to touch as a neurological condition.
meanings.sent3: Despite the cold weather, his insensibility to temperature made him walk around in just a t-shirt.
meanings.sent4: The insensibility of the stone to the sculptor's chisel made it a challenging material to work with.
meanings.sent5: The insensibility of the robot to emotions made it difficult for the child to bond with it.

meanings.sent1: After the accident, he fell into a deep insensibility and couldn't remember what happened.
meanings.sent2: The medication induced a state of insensibility, allowing the patient to undergo the surgery without pain.
meanings.sent3: His insensibility to his surroundings caused him to bump into things while daydreaming.
meanings.sent4: The insensibility of the sleepwalker to obstacles in his path amazed his family.
meanings.sent5: The insensibility of the bear to the tranquilizer dart surprised the wildlife experts.

meanings.definition: Inability to be affected or influenced.
meanings.sent1: Her insensibility to criticism made her a strong and confident leader.
meanings.sent2: The politician's insensibility to public opinion led to his downfall in the election.
meanings.sent3: The insensibility of the rock to the wind's erosion kept it standing tall for centuries.
meanings.sent4: The insensibility of the metal to rusting made it the perfect material for the ship's hull.
meanings.sent5: The insensibility of the child to peer pressure allowed him to stay true to his values.
